Package filePackage

Class FileSystemTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • filePackage.FileSystemTree
  • public class FileSystemTree
extends java.lang.Object
    FileSystemTree class has addDir addFile printTree and remove methods which each is used to manipulate a general tree structure.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private class  FileSystemTree.FileNode
      FileNode class is a private class represents a file of a directory according to desire

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int counter
      counter is used to prettyPrint the Tree as needed
      private boolean found
      found is used to halt or break the adding process when the certain directory of file is found and added successfully
      (package private) FileSystemTree.FileNode root
      root is reference ot root node

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FileSystemTree​(java.lang.String rootName)
      FileSystemTree class constructor takes rootName and creates a node to root directory.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void addDir​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head, java.lang.String[] path)
      this function adds a directory to it's desired location I have used a recursion to trace the general tree and find the desired location to add a directory if exist function takes a path as a String arrays which's last element is the name of the directory to be added to the general tree also head or root of the tree to start tracing from.
      protected void addDir​(java.lang.String path)
      addDir function takes a path to directory and calls it's wrapper function with root reference.
      private void addFile​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head, java.lang.String[] path)
      this function adds a file to it's desired location I have used the recursion to trace the general tree and find the desired location to add a file if exist function takes a path as a String arrays which's last element is the name of the file to be added to the general tree also head or root of the tree to start tracing from.
      protected void addFile​(java.lang.String path)
      addDir function takes a path to file and calls it's wrapper function with root reference.
      private boolean isExist​(java.lang.String nodeName, FileSystemTree.FileNode head)
      this function takes a string and a node reference and checks whether node's children contains the given nodeName string or not
      private void print​(FileSystemTree.FileNode node)
      this function prints the whole general tree using recursion.
      protected void printFileSystem()
      this function prints the whole general tree by callings its wrapper function named print()
      private void printPath​(char type, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> path)
      this function takes a path and prints it
      private void remove​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head, java.lang.String[] path)
      this function takes path and head and removes a file or directory if exist or if possible by using recursion.
      protected void remove​(java.lang.String path)
      this function takes a directory of file path and removes it from general tree if possible by calling its wrapper function
      protected void search​(java.lang.String sampleText)
      search function calls its wrapper search function to handle the search operation.
      private void search​(java.lang.String sampleText, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> path, FileSystemTree.FileNode currentHead)
      function makes use of recursion to trace the whole tree and find and print the desired path its base case is if current nodes' node name contains the sampleText then print the path starting from root and trace the whole tree each node

    • Method Detail

      • addDir

        protected void addDir​(java.lang.String path)
        addDir function takes a path to directory and calls it's wrapper function with root reference.
        Parameters:
        path - path is the path if directory to be added to the general tree

      • addDir

        private void addDir​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head,
                    java.lang.String[] path)
        this function adds a directory to it's desired location I have used a recursion to trace the general tree and find the desired location to add a directory if exist function takes a path as a String arrays which's last element is the name of the directory to be added to the general tree also head or root of the tree to start tracing from. base case is if we reach the last element of the given String arrays which's our directory path if we reach the last element we added we add the directory to its corresponding parent node's children's list otherwise we keep calling the function itself with new values until we find the desired path
        Parameters:
        head - reference to root directory
        path - path of directory to be added.

      • addFile

        protected void addFile​(java.lang.String path)
        addDir function takes a path to file and calls it's wrapper function with root reference.
        Parameters:
        path - path is the path if file to be added to the general tree

      • addFile

        private void addFile​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head,
                     java.lang.String[] path)
        this function adds a file to it's desired location I have used the recursion to trace the general tree and find the desired location to add a file if exist function takes a path as a String arrays which's last element is the name of the file to be added to the general tree also head or root of the tree to start tracing from. base case is if we reach the last element of the given String arrays which's our file path if we reach the last element we added we add the file to its corresponding parent node's children's list otherwise we keep calling the function itself with new values until we find the desired path
        Parameters:
        head - reference to root file
        path - path of file to be added.

      • remove

        protected void remove​(java.lang.String path)
        this function takes a directory of file path and removes it from general tree if possible by calling its wrapper function
        Parameters:
        path - path of the directory of file to be removed from general tree

      • remove

        private void remove​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head,
                    java.lang.String[] path)
        this function takes path and head and removes a file or directory if exist or if possible by using recursion. base case is if we reach the last element of string array which holds path this function finds the file of directory to be removed if exist and check if it is file then removes it or if it is a nonempty directory then asks user whether to delete it or not and acts accordingly.
        Parameters:
        head - reference root if the tree
        path - path of the directory or file to be removed from general tree

      • search

        protected void search​(java.lang.String sampleText)
        search function calls its wrapper search function to handle the search operation.
        Parameters:
        sampleText - string to be looked to it's identical

      • search

        private void search​(java.lang.String sampleText,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> path,
                    FileSystemTree.FileNode currentHead)
        function makes use of recursion to trace the whole tree and find and print the desired path its base case is if current nodes' node name contains the sampleText then print the path starting from root and trace the whole tree each node
        Parameters:
        sampleText - string to be looked for its identical
        path - path string is used to handle the back end fort path changes of general tree to prettyPrint
        currentHead - head type of FileNode class

      • isExist

        private boolean isExist​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                        FileSystemTree.FileNode head)
        this function takes a string and a node reference and checks whether node's children contains the given nodeName string or not
        Parameters:
        nodeName - name of the node to be looked for
        head - head node rerefence
        Returns:
        returns true if the head's children contains nodeName string otherwise return false

      • printPath

        private void printPath​(char type,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> path)
        this function takes a path and prints it
        Parameters:
        type - d for directory and f for files
        path - path to be printed

      • printFileSystem

        protected void printFileSystem()
        this function prints the whole general tree by callings its wrapper function named print()

      • print

        private void print​(FileSystemTree.FileNode node)
        this function prints the whole general tree using recursion.
        Parameters:
        node - root node
